description: Add polish to your UI with Svelte's built-in transition engine: fade, fly, slide, and custom animations.

slides.title: Built-in Transitions
slides.content:
# Easy Animation ‚ú®

Svelte has an animation engine built-in.

Just import `fade`, `fly`, `slide`, `scale`, `draw`, `crossfade` from `svelte/transition`.

Use the `transition:` directive on any element.

slides.title: Local Transitions
slides.content:
# local modifier üè†

By default, transitions play when a parent block is added/removed.

Use `local` to only play when the element ITSELF is added/removed, ignoring parent changes.

```html
<div transition:slide|local>
```

slides.title: Deferred Transitions
slides.content:
# Crossfade üé≠

Create the illusion of an element moving from one list to another.

Use `crossfade` to pair an element being removed from A with an element being added to B.

Does magic with absolute positioning and transforms.

slides.title: The animate Directive
slides.content:
# FLIP Animation ü§∏

When re-ordering a list, items usually jump instantly.

Use `animate:flip` to make them slide to their new positions.

```html
<li animate:flip="{{ duration: 500 }}">
```
(Must serve inside a keyed each block).

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Transitions üéì

Professional Polish.

- **Directives:** `transition:`, `in:`, `out:`.
- **Presets:** `fade`, `fly`, `slide`, `scale`.
- **Custom:** Define CSS keyframes in JS.
- **Animate:** `animate:flip` for reordering lists.
- **Events:** Listen for start/end.
